name: Teff Pancakes With Chia, Millet and Blueberries
description: If you’re trying to work more grains and seeds into your diet, a pancake can be a good home for them. These are hearty pancakes – 3 make a good breakfast – with nice texture.
keywords: chia seeds, millet, teff flour, halal, healthy, high fiber, kosher, nut-free, vegetarian, main course
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup (75 grams) teff flour (I make the flour by grinding the grain in a spice mill)
1 cup (125 grams) white whole-wheat flour or regular whole-wheat flour
1 tablespoon sugar, honey or agave syrup
1 6-ounce box blueberries tossed with 1/2 teaspoon all-purpose flour

recipeInstructions.text: Sift together the teff, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and sugar (if using sugar). In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, buttermilk, oil, vanilla, and honey or agave nectar if using. Quickly whisk in the flour mixture and fold in the chia seeds and millet.

Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat and brush with butter or oil. Drop the pancakes by the scant 1/4 cup onto the hot pan or griddle. Place 7 or 8 blueberries on each pancake, gently pushing them down into the batter. Cook until bubbles break through and turn the pancakes. Cook for about 1 minute on the other side, until lightly browned. Remove to a rack. Serve with maple syrup and butter.
